message_1: What products will form when acetic acid react with sodium bicarbonate?
message_2:
When acetic acid (CH3COOH) reacts with sodium bicarbonate (NaHCO3), the products formed are sodium acetate (CH3COONa), carbon dioxide (CO2), and water (H2O). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

CH3COOH + NaHCO3 â†’ CH3COONa + CO2 + H2O
